text: REFERENCE FOR CALCULATION Litchfield, J. T. and Wilcoxin F. , J. of Pharmacol and Exper. Ther., 90: 99 , 1948. LD50 (95% CONFIDENCE LIMITS) 3.5 (3.1 to 3.9 g /kg CONCLUSION This compound appears to act as a CNS depressant with symptons of respiratory depression, constriction of blood vessels, and in- activity. Survivors recovered in 48 hours. The recommended safe dose for a single trial by inhalation in man is 0.3 mg.
